page.title: 17A Local Craftswoman's Day
page.content: Sibylle Wex lives on the Burton Pynsent Estate and works at home. She has a very big bedroom in which she sleeps and works. She paints on silk and then leaves the silk to dry, while on another piece of silk she applies some gutta which keeps the paints from running into one another. She sometimes listens to some music on the radio. At about 12 o'clock, she has a coffee break. She makes herself a cup of coffee and a sandwich and maybe she has a piece of chocolate. She starts to paint at least three bits of silk which she makes into blouses later. She starts to make the evening meal when the children come home. After the evening meal she watches television or listens to music. While doing that she hems the scarves that have been steamed that day before she goes to bed at about half past 10.
